paragraphs: Event-exclusive Timed Research
Complete this Timed Research to earn encounters with Pokémon featured throughout the Precious Paths season!
A GO Pass is a free, limited-time progression track available during a specified period. By collecting GO Points, you can increase your rank to earn rewards.

Trainers will automatically receive GO Pass: Pokémon 30th Anniversary on Tuesday, March 3, at 10:00 a.m. local time. You can collect GO Points and rank up to get additional rewards through Monday, March 9, at 8:00 p.m. local time.
Additionally, from Saturday, March 7, at 12:00 a.m. to Monday, March 9, at 7:59 p.m. local time, there’s no daily limit for how many GO Points you can earn!
For US$7.99, Trainers can upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe, a paid version of the GO Pass that offers upgraded rewards and faster progression.
For US$9.99*, Trainers can upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe + 10 Ranks to also automatically earn enough GO Points to reach Rank 11.

While progressing through the GO Pass Deluxe, you’ll be able to claim all of the rewards from both the free GO Pass and GO Pass Deluxe. You can upgrade to a GO Pass Deluxe at any time and still collect rewards from previously unlocked ranks.
Rewards unlocked in the GO Pass will expire on Sunday, March 15, at 7:59 p.m. local time, so be sure to claim your rewards before they’re gone!
Complete Pass Tasks to rank up your GO Pass to earn the following rewards.
Trainers who upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe can also earn the following rewards.
lists: Encounters with Pokémon first discovered in the Kanto region
Additional encounters with even more Pokémon first discovered in the Kanto region, including Articuno*, Zapdos*, and Moltres*!

paragraphs: Ditto are changing into different Pokémon in the wild during the event! Catch Pokémon in the wild to find a Ditto in disguise.

From Saturday, March 7, at 10:00 a.m. to Monday, March 9, at 8:00 p.m. local time, the Pokémon 30th Anniversary: All Out event brings back almost all Pokémon that have ever appeared in Pokémon GO. Explore different biomes for wild spawns, take on expanded raids (including Legendary Pokémon and trainer-hat Pikachu), hatch baby Pokémon from 2 km Eggs, and enjoy bonuses like Incense that may lead to Legendary encounters and more frequent wild spawns.
Reach Major Milestones on your GO Pass to unlock the following bonuses.
Upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe to get the following boosted bonuses.
Upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe to get the following boosted bonuses.
Upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe to get the following boosted bonuses.
The following Pokémon will appear in raids from Tuesday, March 3, at 10:00 a.m. to Monday, March 9, at 8:00 p.m. local time.

Event-themed Field Research tasks will be available during the event! Complete Field Research tasks to earn encounters with the following Pokémon or other rewards such as Rare Candy, a Silver Pinap Berry, or a Golden Razz Berry.

The GO Pass Deluxe, the paid version of the GO Pass, will be available on the Pokémon GO Web Store! Your GO Pass Deluxe purchased via the Pokémon GO Web Store will activate as soon as the GO Pass begins.

Trainers who upgrade to GO Pass Deluxe: Pokémon 30th Anniversary or GO Pass Deluxe: Pokémon 30th Anniversary + 10 Ranks on the Pokémon GO Web Store will receive 10 Ultra Balls, five Max Revives, one Premium Battle Pass, and five Max Potions as a gift with purchase.

Or stock up on the essentials alongside your upgrade with the web-exclusive GO Pass Deluxe: Pokémon 30th Anniversary + 10 Ranks Ultra Box which includes 20 Ultra Balls, 10 Max Revives, 10 Max Potions, two Premium Battle Passes, one Incubator, and one Super Incubator as a gift with purchase!

bonuses.text: Incense activated during the event may lead to encounters with Legendary Pokémon—if you're very lucky!
Wild Pokémon will appear more frequently

paragraphs: The following Pokémon will appear in raids.

Buzzwole will appear in the Americas and Greenland. Pheromosa will appear in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and India. Xurkitree will appear in Asia-Pacific. Celesteela will appear in the Southern Hemisphere. Kartana will appear in the Northern Hemisphere. Stakataka will appear in the Eastern Hemisphere. Blacephalon will appear in the Western Hemisphere.

Buzzwole will appear in the Americas and Greenland. Pheromosa will appear in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and India. Xurkitree will appear in Asia-Pacific. Celesteela will appear in the Southern Hemisphere. Kartana will appear in the Northern Hemisphere. Stakataka will appear in the Eastern Hemisphere. Blacephalon will appear in the Western Hemisphere.

Buzzwole will appear in the Americas and Greenland. Pheromosa will appear in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and India. Xurkitree will appear in Asia-Pacific. Celesteela will appear in the Southern Hemisphere. Kartana will appear in the Northern Hemisphere. Stakataka will appear in the Eastern Hemisphere. Blacephalon will appear in the Western Hemisphere.
The following Pokémon will hatch from 2 km Eggs.
Mime Jr. will continue to only hatch in certain parts of the world.

bonuses.text: 10× XP for spinning a PokéStop for the first time
bonuses.bonusType: XP for spinning a PokéStop for the first time

bonuses.text: Increased chance to encounter Shiny Sudowoodo and Shiny Zorua

paragraphs: New costumed Pokémon will debut during this event!
Costumed Ditto are changing into different Pokémon in the wild during the event! You may encounter them disguised as various species—catch Pokémon in the wild to find costumed Ditto.
The following Pokémon will appear in raids.
Complete Field Research tasks to earn items, Stardust, or encounters with event-themed Pokémon.
Timed Research will be available throughout the event! Complete tasks to earn Stardust, encounters with event-themed Pokémon, stickers, and more!
Please note that Timed Research expires. The tasks associated with this Timed Research must be completed and their rewards must be claimed before March 16, 2026 at 8 pm local time.
Event-exclusive Collection Challenges are coming! Complete the catch-themed Collection Challenges to receive encounters with event-themed Pokémon, including costumed Pokémon!
A new avatar item will be available for free in the in-game shop during this event and will continue to be available after the event ends!
You’ll be able to get event-themed stickers by spinning PokéStops and Gyms, opening Gifts, and by completing tasks in Timed Research.
Ditto wearing a hat and Ditto wearing a cap may be encountered as Shiny or with an event-themed Special Background. If you’re lucky, you may encounter a Shiny one!

bonuses.text: Different Pokémon will be attracted to regular Lure Modules during the event
Paras, Combee, and Cutiefly attracted to regular Lure Modules will have an increased chance to be Shiny
2× XP for successfully catching Pokémon with Nice Throws or better
bonuses.bonusType: XP for successfully catching Pokémon with Nice Throws or better

bonuses.text: GO Pass Deluxe: 3× Candy for successfully catching Pokémon

paragraphs: The following Pokémon first discovered in the Galar region will make their Pokémon GO debuts!
You can use 25 Blipbug Candy to evolve Blipbug into Dottler and 100 Blipbug Candy to evolve Dottler into Orbeetle.
From Tuesday, March 17, at 10:00 a.m. to Monday, March 23, 2026, at 8:00 p.m. local time, the GO Pass and GO Pass Deluxe for Bug Out will be available in Pokémon GO!
A GO Pass is a free, limited-time progression track available during a specified period. By collecting GO Points, you can increase your rank to earn rewards.

Trainers will automatically receive the GO Pass for Bug Out on Tuesday, March 17, at 10:00 a.m. local time. You can collect GO Points and rank up to get additional rewards through Monday, March 23, 2026, at 8:00 p.m. local time.
For US$4.99*, Trainers can upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe, a paid version of the GO Pass that offers upgraded rewards and faster progression.
For US$6.99*, Trainers can upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe + 6 Ranks to also automatically earn enough GO Points to reach Rank 7.

While progressing through the GO Pass Deluxe, you’ll be able to claim all of the rewards from both the free GO Pass and GO Pass Deluxe. You can upgrade to a GO Pass Deluxe at any time and still collect rewards from previously unlocked ranks.
Rewards unlocked in the GO Pass will expire on Wednesday, March 25, 2026, at 8:00 p.m. local time, so be sure to claim your rewards before they’re gone!
*All prices listed are in USD or the equivalent pricing tier in your local currency.
Complete Pass Tasks to rank up your GO Pass to earn the following rewards.
Trainers who upgrade to the GO Pass Deluxe can also earn the following rewards.
